metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7072 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: An issue has been found in PowerDNS Authoritative Server before 3.4.11 and4.0.2 allowing a remote, unauthenticated attacker to cause a denial ofservice by opening a large number of TCP connections to the web server. Ifthe web server runs out of file descriptors, it triggers an exception andterminates the whole PowerDNS process. While it's more complicated for anunauthorized attacker to make the web server run out of file descriptorssince its connection will be closed just after being accepted, it mightstill be possible.

criterions.comment: pdns: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
